description: Machine-readable catalog of Fundamental Library Styles components

fundamental-styles.name: fundamental-styles
fundamental-styles.description: Main component library with 117+ UI components

components.name: Action Bar
components.description: The action bar displays at the top of the page, and includes the page’s title, description, back button and action buttons.

components.name: Action Sheet
components.description: An action sheet consists of a list of options a user can select from to complete an action. Actions can be

components.name: Ai Busy Indicator
components.description: Ai Busy Indicator component

components.name: Ai Loading Bar
components.description: Ai Loading Bar component

components.name: Ai Text
components.description: Ai Text component

components.name: Ai Writing Assistant Versioning
components.description: Ai Writing Assistant Versioning component

components.name: Ai Writing Assistant
components.description: Ai Writing Assistant component

components.name: Alert
components.description: Important message banner for critical system messages

components.name: Avatar Group
components.description: The avatar group displays a number of avatars, which act as a digital representation of a user. This control is useful for visualizing a team, project team members, or a group of employees, for example.

components.name: Avatar
components.description: User profile picture or initials display

components.name: Badge
components.description: Badge component

components.name: Bar
components.description: The Bar is a container primarily used for displaying titles, buttons, and input controls. It serves as the foundational design and functionality for page headers, footers, dialogs, and popovers that require a header and/or footer. A header can consist of just a title or a title with a navigation button (back or home) at the front. A subheader can also be included in the header design. Footers can be either fixed or floating. The buttons in the footer are intended for finalizing actions, following a primary-to-tertiary hierarchy, and should be positioned in the right area.

components.name: Breadcrumb
components.description: The breadcrumb component is a type of navigation that indicates the position of a page within the application’s page hierarchy. Users can navigate backward by selecting the previous pages in the navigation path.

components.name: Busy Indicator
components.description: The busy indicator component informs the user about an ongoing operation. Only one busy indicator should be shown at a time.

components.name: Button Split
components.description: Button Split component

components.name: Button
components.description: Action trigger with multiple styles for different semantic meanings
avoidWhen: Navigating to a different page (use link instead)

components.name: Calendar
components.description: The calendar component allows users to navigate to a single date, multiple days, whole week(s), or a date range, showing all time-related data within a given timeframe.

components.name: Card
components.description: Content card container for grouping related information

components.name: Carousel
components.description: The carousel component is used for browsing through a set of images. One or several items can be displayed at a time, and the user can navigate to either the next or the previous item.

components.name: Checkbox
components.description: Multiple selection control for selecting multiple options

components.name: Code
components.description: The code component helps with formating and styling code snippets. It differantiates the code lines from the normal text.

components.name: Counter
components.description: Counter component

components.name: Dialog
components.description: Modal dialog window for displaying important information or forms

components.name: Dynamic Page
components.description: Dynamic Page component

components.name: Dynamic Side Content
components.description: Dynamic Side Content component

components.name: Facet
components.description: Facet component

components.name: Feed Input
components.description: The feed input is specifically designed for users to type their own notes or comments and post them to a corresponding feed.

components.name: Feed List
components.description: The feed list displays feed list items that individually consist of a username, a written entry and an optional image. There is also a separate byline below that can contain a time stamp or an attribute in the form of free text.

components.name: Fieldset
components.description: Fieldset component

components.name: File Uploader
components.description: The File Uploader component allows the user to select the files from the system to upload.

components.name: Fixed Card Layout
components.description: Fixed Card Layout component

components.name: Flexible Column Layout
components.description: Flexible Column Layout component

components.name: Form Group
components.description: Form Group component

components.name: Form Header
components.description: Form Header component

components.name: Form Item
components.description: Container for individual form field with label and input

components.name: Form Label
components.description: Label for form inputs with required indicator support

components.name: Form Layout Grid
components.description: Form Layout Grid component

components.name: Form Message
components.description: Form Message component

components.name: Generic Tag
components.description: The generic tag control displays complementary information related to the current page, such as key performance indicators (KPI) and situations.

components.name: Grid List
components.description: Grid List component

components.name: Helpers
components.description: Helpers component

components.name: Horizontal Navigation
components.description: Horizontal Navigation component

components.name: Icon Tab Bar
components.description: The Icon Tab Bar can be used for navigation within an object, or as a filter. Each tab of the component links to a different content area or view.

components.name: Icon
components.description: SAP icon font for displaying icons throughout the UI

components.name: Illustrated Message
components.description: Illustrated messages for SAP Fiori are a simple yet powerful way to engage users and add personality to the experience.

components.name: Info Label
components.description: Info Label is a small non-interactive numeric or text-based label.

components.name: Input Group
components.description: Input Group component

components.name: Input
components.description: Single-line text input field for collecting user data

components.name: Layout Grid
components.description: Layout Grid component

components.name: Layout Panel
components.description: Layout Panel component

components.name: Layout
components.description: Layout component

components.name: Link
components.description: Navigation link for moving to different pages or sections

components.name: List
components.description: Vertical list of items for simple or complex data display

components.name: Margins
components.description: Margins component

components.name: Menu
components.description: Contextual menu with list of actions or options

components.name: Message Box
components.description: The message box displays a dialog with a simple message to the user. Contrary to the **Popover**, message box can relay messages unrelated to the UI, such as technical errors. This component inherits the look and behavior of the **Dialog** (excluding dragging/resizing).

components.name: Message Page
components.description: Message page displays a message to the user when an app or list is empty or if an error has occurred. The text and icon on the message page changes depending on the use case, however, the layout stays the same. It is responsive and adjusts to fit the available screen space.

components.name: Message Popover
components.description: A Message Popover is used to display a summarized list of different types of messages (error, warning, success, and information messages).

components.name: Message Strip
components.description: Inline informational message for contextual feedback

components.name: Message Toast
components.description: The message toast is a small, non-disruptive popup for success messages that disappears automatically after a few seconds. When message toast is displayed, it is always centered horizontally at the bottom of the screen and fades in and out automatically.

components.name: Micro Process Flow
components.description: The micro process flow control enables you to visualize the state of individual items in a linear workflow. You can embed it into a list or a table.

components.name: Navigation List
components.description: Navigation List component

components.name: Navigation Menu
components.description: Navigation Menu component

components.name: Navigation
components.description: Navigation component

components.name: Notification
components.description: Notifications are used to relay information to the user about a situation or task that requires their input. They can notice and access the notifications by the bell icon in the shell bar on the top-right of the screen. In the notification popover, they take immediate action, navigate to the source of a specific notification or in the case of a notification group, they can sort the list items in various ways.

components.name: Numeric Content
components.description: Numeric Content component

components.name: Object Attribute
components.description: Object Attribute component

components.name: Object Identifier
components.description: The object identifier is a short text that represents the key identifier of an object, and can be displayed in various types of containers, tables, panels, popovers and more. The text wraps if there is insufficient horizontal space.

components.name: Object List
components.description: An object list is a type of list that consists of object list items, where each item provides a quick

components.name: Object Marker
components.description: Object marker indicates the technical status of an object. It display the technical state like (draft,

components.name: Object Number
components.description: An object number represents a numeric attribute of an object and its unit. The object number should be displayed with semantics to provide more insight to the user about the object's value.

components.name: Object Status
components.description: Object Status is a short text that represents the semantic status of an object. It has a semantic

components.name: Off Screen
components.description: Off Screen component

components.name: Paddings
components.description: Paddings component

components.name: Page Footer
components.description: Page Footer component

components.name: Page
components.description: Page component

components.name: Pagination
components.description: Pagination allows users to separate their content into discrete pages, making it easier to digest and navigate through. Pagination is commonly used for tables and tiles.

components.name: Panel
components.description: The panel is a container for grouping and displaying information. Panels are responsive and can be collapsed to save additional screen space.

components.name: Popover
components.description: Contextual popup for displaying supplementary information

components.name: Product Switch
components.description: The product switch provides users with role-based access to several products or lines of businesses (LoBs). The product switch displays an icon button that triggers a **Popover** with the products or LoBs. Because it is designed to be as simple as possible, the product switch only has one level of navigation.

components.name: Progress Indicator
components.description: The progress indicator visualizes the current advancement of a process or a degree of accomplishment. The inside of the progress indicator is filled with color to indicate the state of progress. The advancement depends on the specific process. The progress is shown either using absolute numbers or the current percentage of completion together with a progress bar.

components.name: Prompt Input
components.description: Prompt Input component

components.name: Quick View
components.description: The quick view is similar to a popover but has a predefined structure, a fixed set of UI

components.name: Radio Button
components.description: Single selection control for choosing one option from a group

components.name: Rating Indicator
components.description: The rating indicator displays a group of icons or images (usually stars) that indicate a rating.

components.name: Resizable Card Layout
components.description: Resizable Card Layout component

components.name: Scrollbar
components.description: Themeable scrollbar is the scrollbar component made accordingly to the Fiori 3 design guidelines.

components.name: Search Field
components.description: The Search Field component is intended to be used in BTP Tool Header.

components.name: Section
components.description: Section component

components.name: Segmented Button
components.description: Segmented Button component

components.name: Select
components.description: Dropdown selection control for choosing one option from many

components.name: Settings
components.description:
The Settings Dialog allows users to personalize their Fiori experience by adjusting various settings.

Layout and Structure

components.name: Shellbar
components.description: Application header bar with branding, navigation, and actions

components.name: Side Nav
components.description: Side Nav component

components.name: Skeleton
components.description: Placeholder loading is a type of busy indicator that provides the user with a skeleton page as a placeholder while the content is still loading. The aim is to inform the user of the ongoing loading progress.

components.name: Slider
components.description: There are two types of sliders, Standard Slider and Range Slider. The standard slider is a control that enables the user to adjust single values within a specified numerical range. The range slider enables the user to select a value range within a predefined numerical interval.

components.name: Splitter
components.description: Splitter component

components.name: Status Indicator
components.description: The status indicator displays a SVG images that indicate a pictorial representation of an object.

components.name: Step Input
components.description: The step input control allows the user to change the input values in predefined increments (steps).

components.name: Switch
components.description: The switch mimics a physical switch, allowing users to set individual features (such as personalization or display settings) to either active or inactive. What the switch controls should be clarified with an inline label, while the state it’s currently in should be displayed on the switch itself.

components.name: Table
components.description: Structured data table for displaying and interacting with tabular data

components.name: Tabs
components.description: Tabs component

components.name: Text
components.description: The text component displays text inside a form, table, or any other content area.

components.name: Textarea
components.description: Multi-line text input for collecting long-form content

components.name: Tile
components.description: Tile component

components.name: Time
components.description: The time component is used to select a time value. It can be used to choose hours, minutes, seconds and/or a given period of the day. This component is rarely used alone and will likely be paired with the **Time Picker** pattern.

components.name: Timepicker
components.description:
The time picker allows the user to select a localized time, based on the 12-hour syste or the 24-hour system. It can be used with touch, mouse, or keyboard input.
For more information visit Fiori Design Guidelines

components.name: Title Bar
components.description: Title Bar component

components.name: Title
components.description: A title component whose semantic level and visual appearance can be set separately, providing flexibility in design while adhering to accessibility best practices.

components.name: Token
components.description: Tokens are small items of information (similar to tags) that mainly serve to visualize previously selected items. The tokenizer is the container that handles the tokens. Tokens can be added, removed, selected, or deselected.

components.name: Tokenizer
components.description: Tokenizer is a container that wraps multiple tokens. The Tokenizer is used either stand alone or within Input controls such as **MultiInput**.In cozy mode the user can swipe the tokens to the left or right.

components.name: Tool Header
components.description: Tool Header component

components.name: Tool Layout
components.description: Tool Layout component

components.name: Toolbar
components.description: The toolbar enables the user to change the UI or trigger an action. For example, the user can change views, manipulate data or objects, navigate to another page, perform generic actions, and so on. This component is usually paired with buttons, which are always right-aligned.

components.name: Tree
components.description: Tree allows the user to display and work with a hierarchical set of items. Trees are mostly used in the master list for a master-detail scenario using the **Flexible Column Layout** and in **Popovers** or **Dialogs**. In certain use cases, they can also be used in the **Dynamic Page Layout**.

components.name: Upload Collection
components.description: The upload collection control allows users to upload single or multiple files from a device (desktop, tablet, or phone) to the SAP Fiori app. Typically, uploaded files appear in an Attachments tab. However, files can also be displayed elsewhere.

components.name: User Menu
components.description: The User Menu is an integral part of the Shell Bar, accessible by clicking the avatar located at its far-right end. It provides user-specific options and remains available across all screens. In addition to standard options, the User Menu can include product-specific functionality.

components.name: Variant Management
components.description: Variants store filter settings which have been defined, for example, within the filter bar.

components.name: Vertical Nav
components.description: Vertical Nav component

components.name: Wizard
components.description: Wizard component
